comments.author: Nelson “HardCoreGamer” Trahan

comments.text:
I love this, I think it's really innovative and it's gorgeous on the ears, 
but I'm curious about the title? Isn't a 'requiem' composed to mourn the 
dead, particularly at Mass? I know that they don't really need to be 
religious any more, not since Verdi and such, but I don't detect any hint 
of mourning in this music... But I only bring this up in the hope that it 
might help for when you come to sell this track, which I hope you do! I'd 
certainly buy it :)﻿

comments.text:
Requiem means "Rest" in Latin. This piece was made to soothe and calm, as a 
sort of lullaby, as is its melodic nature. I never thought, though, that an 
electric guitar, an icon of noise and rebellion, can create music unrivaled 
in its quality and complexity :)﻿

comments.author: perry wilson

comments.text:
It's isn't musically that interesting (when looked at is technically). It 
is not very dynamic, it's just ambient. The only "special" thing about this 
is the way he uses the guitar. Which is tuned in an open tuning. So it's 
just playing a "small" chapman stick.
And not everyone likes this kind of music. I found it enjoyable enough to 
not dislike it, but I can understand why other did though.
